fields.description:
Admin users of accounts can't delete volumes created by users of part of that account.

{code}
1. [root@frontend ~]# euca-describe-volumes verbose | grep
vol-0505422C
2. VOLUME vol-0505422C 2 partner01
available 2012-04-24T01:39:09.000Z
3. [root@frontend ~]# euca-delete-volume vol-0505422C
4. [root@frontend ~]# euca-describe-volumes verbose | grep
vol-0505422C
5. VOLUME vol-0505422C 2 partner01
available 2012-04-24T01:39:09.000Z
6. [root@partner-frontend ~]# euca-delete-volume --debug vol-0505422C

What needs to be done to resolve this issue?  Is there a simple workaround/fix to help resolve this?
fields.summary: Unable to delete user volumes and snapshots

comments.body: Requesting to have Neil check out EPC.

Confirmed on 3.0.2.  

This is a bit like the security group stuff.  Our superuser powers for eucalyptus/admin are not being applied! :)

Here's my guess.

The volume state on the SC is available (both at the higher SC level and the backend iSCSI level).

For some reason (either SC didn't get the request, or request timed out), the volume on the SC was never deleted.

I don't believe the CLC has a transition from ANNIHILATING to EXTANT.

i.e., when the SC reports back a volume as "available" when it is already flagged for deletion, I don't think the CLC will change state back to EXTANT.

But I am not positive and will need to double check this hypothesis with the CLC team.

The workaround is to try changing the state of the rows in Volumes in eucalyptus_cloud to "EXTANT" and see if the CLC will then delete them.

Basically, the volumes that are marked as "available" in the Volumes table in eucalyptus_storage, must much what eucalyptus_cloud is reporting.

A restart of the CLC may also fix the issue, but the user may not be open to that.

I am sure this is something a cloud administrator , super user of the cloud would like to have in his arsenal of tools. The proposed method is not something a system administrator should be performing. 

Does it makes sense to fork a new feature request here for having the system accept this as an argument with the euca-delete-* commands like --auth=admin and based on the credentials make a decision and delete/not-delete the volume/snapshot etc.

Please let us know if you have any questions.
Thing is, it should work by default if your in the eucalyptus account anyway, since thats for cloud admins.

I created a volume as a user of the cloud and then tried to delete that volume as cloud administrator , it takes the command but does not give any output.

After that when I check the volume is still there. Nothing has really happened.

Ideally the cloud administrator should be able to delete the volume created by the user, as he is the super user of the cloud, so this is the BUG

Hope the above information has helped the engineer in resolving the BUG. Let me know if there are any questions.

Cheers!
Deependra
Note, same applies for snapshots.
The proposed workaround of changing a volume (presumably also snapshot) to EXTANT in eucalyptus_storage and ensuring this matches with eucalyptus_cloud didn't work for me :(

Hey Neil,

Do you have any updates concerning this issue?  IT is blocked by this issue.  This is causing IT not to be able to implement SLAs on the EPC and the future ECC.  Please let us know if you have any questions.

Regards,

Harold Spencer, Jr.
Tried deleting the snapshot from eucalyptus_storage (snapshots and iscsivolumeinfo) and eucalyptus_cloud (metadata_snapshots).  Still shows with "euca-describe-snapshots verbose".
moving it to confirmed so it appears in the sustaining rapid board.

1- Neil trying to figure this out. SC unable to delete or didn't get message. No way to recover w/o restart. Restart is a work around.
2- Admin can not delete volume of user.
I have a one-line fix for volume deletion.  Still looking at snapshots

The attached patch allows the cloud admin to delete volumes and snapshots, while preserving other permissions (i.e., it has been tested to ensure that a non-admin cannot delete things they don't own).

I'll work on a eutester test case for this as well.

The CLC team has reviewed the patch and determined that it won't work. We need a more permanent solution. There was an email discussion with Andy on this.

Some comments from Chris:

"Consequence of this change is that look up times will now be related
to the number of volumes/snapshots in the system (rather than the
requesting user's account).  We've seen this be a meaningful problem
w/ volumes already so we should definitely check w/ a large number of
volumes, instances, and attachments.  I am not so concerned about this
in regard snapshots.

I think the explicit check for admin activity in the service code is
an anti-pattern.  The service code should really not be concerned with
privileges in so far as those checks are made in RestrictedTypes and
should not be duplicated for the sake of sanity/auditability.  That
said, the "fast path" behaviour for the current user which fails can
be followed by an attempt to do the "slow path" admin behaviour."
Still unable to delete volumes and snapshots from Eucalyptus manually.

commit fcf521e424168b31fe67af09014b82261aedec77
Author: Ye Wen <wenye@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Fri Nov 9 10:19:10 2012 -0800

    Enable cloud admin to delete any volume/snapshot

    Fix EUCA-3650

Great news Ye, thank you.

Can we get the target build identified?  Thanks guys.
Also noticed something else on a 3.0.2 cloud which I haven't tested on 3.1.X yet but is certainly related I think.  It appears a eucalyptus admin user is unable to attach/detach users volumes.

Fix is verified:

1) created non-admin user
2) created volume and snapshot as non-admin user
3) successfully deleted both the volume and the snapshot as admin

verify result:PASS
release:euca3.2
1,use non-admin account create 1G volume and snapshot
2,use admin account to delete volume and snapshot
3,succesful"
